articles.headline: A New Orleans Home Is Reborn, With Persistence
articles.snippet: In a city that still seems largely stuck in the mud, two New Orleans residents never stopped pushing ahead.
articles.abstract: In a city that still seems largely stuck in the mud, two New Orleans residents never stopped pushing ahead.
articles.lead_paragraph: NEW ORLEANS — It no longer stinks at 7023 Fleur de Lis Drive.

articles.headline: Iran Won’t Give Promise to End Uranium Effort
articles.snippet: Iran said it was prepared to enter “serious talks” over its nuclear program, but did not agree to suspend uranium enrichment.
articles.abstract: Iran said it was prepared to enter “serious talks” over its nuclear program, but did not agree to suspend uranium enrichment.
articles.lead_paragraph: TEHRAN, Aug. 22 — Iran responded Tuesday to a set of incentives from Europe and the United States aimed at ending its nuclear program, but did not agree to suspend the enrichment of uranium by the end of the month, the West’s primary demand.

articles.headline: This Fed Chief May Yet Get a Honeymoon
articles.snippet: Many of Federal Reserve Chairman Ben Bernanke’s problems stem from a lack of understanding about how he makes decisions.  Once you realize that, he begins to look a lot better than his critics.
articles.abstract: Many of Federal Reserve Chairman Ben Bernanke’s problems stem from a lack of understanding about how he makes decisions.  Once you realize that, he begins to look a lot better than his critics.

articles.headline: Researchers Yearn to Use AOL Logs, but They Hesitate
articles.snippet: When AOL researchers released users’ search logs last month, many academic researchers balanced a thirst for useful data against concerns over individual privacy.
articles.abstract: When AOL researchers released users’ search logs last month, many academic researchers balanced a thirst for useful data against concerns over individual privacy.
articles.lead_paragraph: When AOL researchers released three months’ worth of users’ query logs to a publicly accessible Web site late last month, Jon Kleinberg, a professor of computer science at Cornell, downloaded the data right away. But when a firestorm over privacy breaches erupted, he decided against using it.

articles.headline: Nation Faltering, Afghans’ Leader Draws Criticism
articles.snippet: President Hamid Karzai is widely viewed as having failed to attend to problems including security and corruption.
articles.abstract: President Hamid Karzai is widely viewed as having failed to attend to problems including security and corruption.
articles.lead_paragraph: LAHORE, Pakistan, Aug. 22 — After months of widespread frustration with corruption, the economy and a lack of justice and security, doubts about President Hamid Karzai of Afghanistan, and by extension the American-led effort to rebuild that nation, have led to a crisis of confidence.

articles.headline: Star Banker, With Future, Emerges Free
articles.snippet: Prosecutors agreed to drop their case against Frank P. Quattrone as long as the former technology banker does not violate any laws in the next year.
articles.abstract: Prosecutors agreed to drop their case against Frank P. Quattrone as long as the former technology banker does not violate any laws in the next year.
articles.lead_paragraph: Frank P. Quattrone is going back to work. After facing criminal charges for three years, Mr. Quattrone, the former technology banker, walked out of Federal District Court in Manhattan yesterday after persuading prosecutors to agree to a deal to dismiss their case, and declared, “I plan to resume my business career.”

articles.headline: Lens Care Solution Is Faulted
articles.snippet: Officials concluded that only one type of  Bausch & Lomb contact lens solution contributed to an outbreak of eye infections earlier this year.
articles.abstract: Officials concluded that only one type of  Bausch & Lomb contact lens solution contributed to an outbreak of eye infections earlier this year.
articles.lead_paragraph: Federal disease control experts and leading eye doctors have formally concluded that ReNu With MoistureLoc from Bausch & Lomb was the only contact lens solution contributing to an outbreak of potentially blinding fungal eye infections earlier this year.

articles.headline: Relief Agencies Find Hezbollah Hard to Avoid
articles.snippet: Hezbollah is doling out aid in Lebanon, but relief agencies that accept U.S. funds are barred from giving money through the militant group.
articles.abstract: Hezbollah is doling out aid in Lebanon, but relief agencies that accept U.S. funds are barred from giving money through the militant group.
articles.lead_paragraph: KHIAM, Lebanon, Aug. 22 — When Mercy Corps and other Western aid agencies reached this devastated village on the front line of the battle between Israel and Hezbollah with food and medicine, they quickly discovered they had a big problem: the United States.
articles.byline: By Robert F. Worth and Hassan M. Fattah

articles.headline: Fired or Quit, Tom Cruise Parts Ways With Studio
articles.snippet: Citing Mr. Cruise’s recent behavior, Viacom’s chairman said that Paramount Pictures was ending its 14-year relationship with the actor’s production company.
articles.abstract: Citing Mr. Cruise’s recent behavior, Viacom’s chairman said that Paramount Pictures was ending its 14-year relationship with the actor’s production company.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 22 — Citing Tom Cruise’s yearlong metamorphosis from pure box-office phenomenon to pop-culture punch line, Viacom’s chairman, Sumner M. Redstone, said Tuesday that Paramount Pictures was ending its 14-year relationship with the actor’s production company.
articles.byline: By David M. Halbfinger and Geraldine Fabrikant

articles.headline: Iran Won’t Give Promise to End Uranium Effort
articles.snippet: Iran responded Tuesday to a set of incentives from Europe and the United States aimed at ending its nuclear program, but did not agree to suspend the enrichment of uranium by the end of the month, the West's primary demand.     In its response, Ir...
articles.abstract: Iran responded Tuesday to a set of incentives from Europe and the United States aimed at ending its nuclear program, but did not agree to suspend the enrichment of uranium by the end of the month, the West's primary demand.     In its response, Iran offered ''serious talks'' over its nuclear activities but did not raise the issue of suspending enrichment by Aug. 31, the deadline established by the United Nations Security Council, Western diplomats said.
articles.lead_paragraph: TEHRAN, Aug. 22 - Iran responded Tuesday to a set of incentives from Europe and the United States aimed at ending its nuclear program, but did not agree to suspend the enrichment of uranium by the end of the month, the West's primary demand.

articles.headline: Researchers Yearn to Use AOL Logs, but They Hesitate
articles.snippet: When AOL researchers released three months' worth of users' query logs to a publicly accessible Web site late last month, Jon Kleinberg, a professor of computer science at Cornell, downloaded the data right away. But when a firestorm over privacy ...
articles.abstract: When AOL researchers released three months' worth of users' query logs to a publicly accessible Web site late last month, Jon Kleinberg, a professor of computer science at Cornell, downloaded the data right away. But when a firestorm over privacy breaches erupted, he decided against using it.     ''Now it's sitting there, in cold storage,'' said Professor Kleinberg, who works on algorithms for understanding the structure of the Web and searching it. ''The number of things it reveals about individual people seems much too much. In general, you don't want to do research on tainted data.''
articles.lead_paragraph: When AOL researchers released three months' worth of users' query logs to a publicly accessible Web site late last month, Jon Kleinberg, a professor of computer science at Cornell, downloaded the data right away. But when a firestorm over privacy breaches erupted, he decided against using it.

articles.headline: Fired or Quit, Tom Cruise Parts Ways With Studio
articles.snippet: Citing Tom Cruise's yearlong metamorphosis from pure box-office phenomenon to pop-culture punch line, Viacom's chairman, Sumner M. Redstone, said Tuesday that Paramount Pictures was ending its 14-year relationship with the actor's production compa...
articles.abstract: Citing Tom Cruise's yearlong metamorphosis from pure box-office phenomenon to pop-culture punch line, Viacom's chairman, Sumner M. Redstone, said Tuesday that Paramount Pictures was ending its 14-year relationship with the actor's production company.     Mr. Cruise's representatives insisted that they had not been fired but instead had quit and had already lined up $100 million in financing to produce movies on their own.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 22 - Citing Tom Cruise's yearlong metamorphosis from pure box-office phenomenon to pop-culture punch line, Viacom's chairman, Sumner M. Redstone, said Tuesday that Paramount Pictures was ending its 14-year relationship with the actor's production company.
articles.byline: By David M. Halbfinger and Geraldine Fabrikant

articles.headline: This Fed Chief May Yet Get a Honeymoon
articles.snippet: WHEN Robert Rubin left Goldman Sachs 14 years ago and came here to join the Clinton administration, he brought a couple of big ideas with him.     The first -- that deficits were bad -- has become the one associated with his name. But the second w...
articles.abstract: WHEN Robert Rubin left Goldman Sachs 14 years ago and came here to join the Clinton administration, he brought a couple of big ideas with him.     The first -- that deficits were bad -- has become the one associated with his name. But the second was probably more profound. It was neither a particularly Democratic nor Republican idea, which explains how it has survived until 2006 and how Ben Bernanke, the Federal Reserve chairman chosen by President Bush, was able to replace Mr. Rubin as its most important champion.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON - WHEN Robert Rubin left Goldman Sachs 14 years ago and came here to join the Clinton administration, he brought a couple of big ideas with him.

articles.headline: Star Banker, With Future, Emerges Free
articles.snippet: Frank P. Quattrone is going back to work. After facing criminal charges for three years, Mr. Quattrone, the former technology banker, walked out of Federal District Court in Manhattan yesterday after persuading prosecutors to agree to a deal to di...
articles.abstract: Frank P. Quattrone is going back to work. After facing criminal charges for three years, Mr. Quattrone, the former technology banker, walked out of Federal District Court in Manhattan yesterday after persuading prosecutors to agree to a deal to dismiss their case, and declared, ''I plan to resume my business career.''     The government's retreat was the first time that prosecutors had dropped such a prominent case without seeking a penalty and came after a series of victories by Mr. Quattrone, culminating in an appeals ruling in March that overturned a 2004 conviction for obstruction of justice.
articles.lead_paragraph: Frank P. Quattrone is going back to work. After facing criminal charges for three years, Mr. Quattrone, the former technology banker, walked out of Federal District Court in Manhattan yesterday after persuading prosecutors to agree to a deal to dismiss their case, and declared, "I plan to resume my business career."

articles.headline: Lens Care Solution Is Faulted
articles.snippet: Federal disease control experts and leading eye doctors have formally concluded that ReNu With MoistureLoc from Bausch & Lomb was the only contact lens solution contributing to an outbreak of potentially blinding fungal eye infections earlier this...
articles.abstract: Federal disease control experts and leading eye doctors have formally concluded that ReNu With MoistureLoc from Bausch & Lomb was the only contact lens solution contributing to an outbreak of potentially blinding fungal eye infections earlier this year.     But the researchers' report, to be published today in The Journal of the American Medical Association, says it remains unclear how the product caused the problems.
articles.lead_paragraph: Federal disease control experts and leading eye doctors have formally concluded that ReNu With MoistureLoc from Bausch & Lomb was the only contact lens solution contributing to an outbreak of potentially blinding fungal eye infections earlier this year.

articles.headline: Relief Agencies Find Hezbollah Hard to Avoid
articles.snippet: When Mercy Corps and other Western aid agencies reached this devastated village on the front line of the battle between Israel and Hezbollah with food and medicine, they quickly discovered they had a big problem: the United States.     Like all ot...
articles.abstract: When Mercy Corps and other Western aid agencies reached this devastated village on the front line of the battle between Israel and Hezbollah with food and medicine, they quickly discovered they had a big problem: the United States.     Like all other international relief agencies here that receive financing from the American government, Mercy Corps is barred from giving out money or aid through Hezbollah, the Shiite militant group that is considered a terrorist organization by the United States. But as with all the most demolished areas in southern Lebanon, where whole villages have been flattened by Israeli bombs and there is no food, water or electricity, this village is the domain of Hezbollah -- and little seems to bypass the group.
articles.lead_paragraph: KHIAM, Lebanon, Aug. 22 - When Mercy Corps and other Western aid agencies reached this devastated village on the front line of the battle between Israel and Hezbollah with food and medicine, they quickly discovered they had a big problem: the United States.
articles.byline: By Robert F. Worth and Hassan M. Fattah

articles.headline: Nation Faltering, Afghans’ Leader Draws Criticism
articles.snippet: After months of widespread frustration with corruption, the economy and a lack of justice and security, doubts about President Hamid Karzai of Afghanistan, and by extension the American-led effort to rebuild that nation, have led to a crisis of co...
articles.abstract: After months of widespread frustration with corruption, the economy and a lack of justice and security, doubts about President Hamid Karzai of Afghanistan, and by extension the American-led effort to rebuild that nation, have led to a crisis of confidence.     Interviews with ordinary Afghans and with foreign diplomats and Afghan officials make it clear that the expanding Taliban insurgency in the south represents the most serious challenge to his presidency to date.
articles.lead_paragraph: LAHORE, Pakistan, Aug. 22 - After months of widespread frustration with corruption, the economy and a lack of justice and security, doubts about President Hamid Karzai of Afghanistan, and by extension the American-led effort to rebuild that nation, have led to a crisis of confidence.

articles.headline: A New Orleans Home Is Reborn, With Persistence
articles.snippet: It no longer stinks at 7023 Fleur de Lis Drive.     There are plenty of awful smells in the ruined houses nearby -- the ones still showing high waterlines and fluorescent orange door scrawls that announce whether corpses were found inside.
articles.abstract: It no longer stinks at 7023 Fleur de Lis Drive.     There are plenty of awful smells in the ruined houses nearby -- the ones still showing high waterlines and fluorescent orange door scrawls that announce whether corpses were found inside.
articles.lead_paragraph: NEW ORLEANS - It no longer stinks at 7023 Fleur de Lis Drive.
